4.20.18  11:18 pm   Your music makes us feel happy, inspired, wistful, and melancholy, and existentially threatened.

Would you say that you mostly feel:

A. Happy
B. Inspired
C. Wistful
D. Melancholy
E. Existentially threatened
F. All of the above and more

     a,b,c, and maybe a tiny small amount of d and e but not much

     yes

     entertainment, and more. not randomness

4.20.18  10:44 pm   Bill...
Bill has two l's...
B-i-l-l...
ll looks like 11...
Eleven...the illuminati has 10 letters...
(Remember that part it comes in soon)
Wurtz....
Germany has those...as food...
Memes are food...
Illuminati is a meme... Meme is 4letters...
Like bill...
Remember the first part? 2illuminati connection...2bill connection...
Bill is a pyramid with an eye on Gravity Falls...
Illuminati is an all seeing eye
....
That must mean...
Bill=Illuminati Eye Pyramid
Wurtz=German food....
Bill Wurtz is...
German Pryramid Eye God Confirmed?

     very good but not german

4.20.18  10:40 pm   i find comfort in other people and other people's work, yet i could never find comfort in myself and my own work. ive tried to create things, but theyve always failed, like i dont feel any emotional connection with my own creations. and its weird, because i feel like i should, i should feel comfortable with myself, i should create. but my instincts are telling me to roam free- to learn, forget about it all- go consume content, find people, read stories, invest in other's worlds and creations. perhaps im rushing the whole "creation" thing. i still have lots to explore in this world, lots to learn. and i want to explore everything. i know  one day itll all make sense. instead of being serious about making art, i should have fun and seek joy in all that has already been made. i feel like ive neglected the beauty the world has presented to me. i need to heal my soul by getting lost within this world. only then creation will blossom. art cannot be forc ed. creation will flow through my fingertips when it comes. 

     that's true

4.20.18  10:36 pm   Help I'm trapped in a phone booth?

     make some calls!

     for how much

4.20.18  9:56 pm   4.18.18  9:32 pm

So what are some shortcuts that you use everyday? Besides Cut, Copy, Paste?

      close window ⌘W, close all windows ⌥⌘W, new window ⌘N, new folder ⇧⌘N, move to trash ⌘⏎, empty trash ⇧⌘⏎, open enclosing folder⌘↑, go to the top of the page (on the internet or in text) ⌘↑, go to the top of a folder without opening the enclosing folder ⌥↑, find ⌘F, find next ⌘G, get info ⌘I, screenshot entire screen ⌘⇧3, screenshot a selected part of the screen ⌘⇧4, screenshot the contents of one window ⌘⇧5, press highlighted button (⏎), save ⌘S, don't save ⌘D, undo ⌘Z, new document ⌘N, open ⌘O, quit ⌘Q, preferences (⌘,), cancel (⌘.), zoom in ⌘-, zoom out ⌘=, switch programs ⌘tab, switch windows within a program ⌘`, select all ⌘A, duplicate ⌘D, export ⌘E; play (spacebar), split region ⌘T, record (r), bounce (⌘B), piano roll (p), library (l), crossfade tool esc0⏎, regular tool esc1⏎, forward 1 bar (.), back 1 bar (,), forward 8 bars >, back 8 bars <, join regions ⌘J, mute track (m), solo track (s), unsolo all tracks ⌥⌃S, mixer (x), go to beginning (⏎) ; crop image ⌘K, adjust colors ⌥⌘C, rotate right ⌘R, flip horizontal ⌘?flip h, adjust size ⌘?adj, make selection a perfect square (hold ⇧ while dragging); set in locator (i), set out locator (o), export ⌘E, fit size to screen ⌘3, full screen ⌘F, loop playback ⌘L; select blade tool (b), select roll tool (r), crop tool, set anchor point (d) nudge selected region or border left or right < >, select pointer tool (a), move playhead to next region border (↓), move playhead to previous region border (↑), split all regions at playhead ⌃V, mute region ⌃B, new sequence ⌘N, sequence settings ⌘9, playback settings ⌘0, render ⌘R, disable rendering (⇪), effects list ⌘5, sequences list ⌘4, insert transition at selected border ⌘T, unlink region's audio ⌘L, close project (⌘?clo pr ⏎), fullscreen (⌘?dig), export (⌘?quic); fill tool (f), brush tool (b), color palette (c), eyedrop (⌥-click), black (⇧B), white (⇧W), zoom to fit screen (x), move tool (m), zoom in (i), zoom out (o), brush size 0-9, opacity level ⌥0-9; go forward a word (opt→), go back a word (opt←), go to the end of a line (⌘→), go to the beginning of a line (⌘←), convert to plaintext ⌘⇧T, bold ⌘B, italics ⌘I, underline ⌘U, color palette ⇧C, show fonts ⌘T and much much more

4.20.18  7:23 pm   I'm sure people ask your for help on this all the time... but, my biggest number 1 road block to being more productive with writing more songs is hands-down lyrics. I know you say to write words together with music and I've always tried to do that, and I've even played around with that random word generator... but lyrics are like a giant fucking anchor tied to me. I can never come up with words that I'm happy with. So I have all these songs that are pretty much finished, but the vocal melody is just like humming or scat singing with some random phrases here and there thrown in. It's like the things I most want to express are the things that are hardest for me to put into words, and I've never been much for writing poetry and stories and stuff, which I know is a different ball game than lyric writing.. but still, I've never considered myself a 'writer'... writing words has just never been my strong suit creatively. I feel like if I could just get more comfort able with lyrics, then I could churn out songs like a machine. But I always second guess myself and I'm afraid I sound too cheesy or cliche or that people will laugh at me or make fun of me or whatever... Can you help?

     if you are afraid of being cliche, then try to use words no one has ever heard before. i think you need to start having a bit more fun
